parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From en and blepo; to look on, i.e. to observe fixedly, or to discern clearly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Of Chaldee origin; the Rock; Cephas, a surname of Peter.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I translate, explain, (b) I interpret the meaning of. From a presumed derivative of Hermes; to translate.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
